introComponent.name: CONRAD SANGMA
introComponent.post: HON'BLE CHIEF MINISTER OF MEGHALAYA & NATIONAL PRESIDENT NPP
introComponent.description: Conrad Kongkal Sangma, born on 27 January 1978, has been the 12th Chief Minister of Meghalaya since 2018. He belongs to the National People's Party. Son of P. A. Sangma, a notable political figure, Conrad served as a member of Parliament for the Tura constituency from 2016 to 2018. He has been a member of the South Tura constituency since 2018 and previously represented the Selsella constituency between 2008 and 2013. He also held key ministerial positions in Meghalaya from 2008 to 2009.

aboutComponent.title: ABOUT CONRAD SANGMA
aboutComponent.description: Conrad K. Sangma, born on January 27, 1978, in Tura, West Garo Hills, Meghalaya, is a prominent Indian politician and the current Chief Minister of Meghalaya. Coming from a political family, he has made significant contributions to the state's governance and development.
additionalParagraphs: Conrad K. Sangma was born on the 27th of January 1978 in Tura, West Garo Hills, Meghalaya. His father Purno Sangma worked as the Chief Minister of Meghalaya and Speaker of the Lok Sabha and his mother Soradini was a housewife. Conrad has two siblings involved in politics; an elder brother James and a sister Agatha who are both in NPP. His other sister, Christy has taken an altogether non-controversial career path.

He was born in Delhi, and he had his education at St. Columba's School. He has a Bachelor of Science in business administration with a concentration in entrepreneurial management from Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania and an MBA in finance from Imperial College London.

In 2009, Conrad got married to Dr. Mehtab Chandee with whom he was blessed with two kids; an elder child Amara who was born in 2011, and the youngest child Katelyn who was born in 2017. Apart from politics, Conrad is into social service in the sense that he is the President of the PA Sangma Foundation, an organization that wants to wipe out illiteracy and pollution. The foundation also runs four colleges in rural Meghalaya, a region that still has a raw taste of architectural mastery. Also, he is the President of the Meghalaya Cricket Association and Sports Academy.

Conrad entered the political arena in the late 1990s assisting his father P. A. Sangma, who was contesting on the NCP ticket. He first vied for a seat in 2004 in the Garo Hills Autonomous District Council and he lost by a small margin. He and his brother James were both elected to the State Assembly in 2008 as members of the NCP. He also served as the Finance, Power, Tourism, General Administration, and IT minister of the state and unveiled his first state budget in his first 10 days in the minister post. In Meghalaya Legislative Assembly he was the Leader of the Opposition from 2009 to 2013. However, he was defeated in the state assembly elections held in 2013 and lost his seat.

The National People's Party was formed in 2016 and Conrad Sangma became the National President of the same after the death of his father in the same year. In May he contested for a by-election for the Tura seat in the Lok Sabha and was victorious with a margin of 1.92 lakh votes.

The NPP has also allied with the national level BJP, which contested in the 2018 Meghalaya legislative assembly election and emerged second party by winning 19 seats in the 60-member house but was defeated by the Indian National Congress. As a result of this, since 30 seats were required to form government, the NPP struck an electoral pact with other regional parties, so that their total number was 34. Conrad Sangma then proceeded to meet the Governor of Meghalaya Ganga Prasad to furnish him with a letter of support from these 34 members with 19 from NPP, six from the United Democratic Party, four from the People's Democratic Front, two from Hill State People's Democratic Party and one Bharatiya Janata Party member besides one independent. He was then announced as the Chief Minister-elect and assumed office on 6 March; he succeeded Mukul Sangma (no relation).

aboutComponent.title: ABOUT JAMES K. SANGMA
aboutComponent.description: James Pangsang Kongkal Sangma, a prominent leader in Meghalaya's political landscape, has been serving the state through various roles since 2008. His commitment to public service and development has been evident throughout his political career.
additionalParagraphs: James Pangsang Kongkal Sangma was a leader of the Meghalaya unit of an Indian political party. He was first elected for the post of the State Assembly in the year 2008 for the Rongchugiri Constituency falling under West Garo Hills District. He was elected as M.L.A. from Dadenggre Constituency in the year 2013 and again elected in the same constituency in the year 2018.

James had his early schooling at St Edmund's School Shillong He further pursued his Bachelor's degree from Ramjas College Delhi University in 1999. He then went to Brunel University in the United Kingdom to obtain his Master's degree in Mass Communication in the year 2000.

He lost his father Purno A Sangma, a prominent political leader who was chief minister of Meghalaya and who also became a speaker of Lok Sabha. Purno A Sangma was one of the influential political leaders from India who served the Tura Constituency and fought for the indigenous population of the North Eastern region of India. James possesses some brothers and Sisters Among them Conrad K Sangma presently holding the post of chief minister of Meghalaya and Agatha Sangma holding the membership of 17th Lok Sabha from the Tura Constituency.

James Sangma has held membership with the National People's Party and at present, he holds the position of the National Spokesperson, National General Secretary-Finance. The NPP started in January 2013 with a still the current leader of the NPP the late Purno A Sangma. It is the only party from the Northeast that has been registered as the "National People's Party" thus addressing the regional agenda of the community at the national forum. To James, the indigenous people of the Northeast need to get a platform and be heard at the national level. He is sure that, unlike the uncongenial external parties, the NPP as a homegrown national party has a primordial interest in the welfare, the culture, the language, and the identity of the Northeast.

aboutComponent.title: ABOUT PURNO AGITOK SANGMA
aboutComponent.description: Purno Agitok Sangma, an eminent personality of Indian politics, was born on 1st September 1947 in Chapahati, a tiny village of Garo Hills in Meghalaya. His journey from a humble background to becoming a stalwart in Indian politics is a testament to his dedication and leadership.
additionalParagraphs: Purno Agitok Sangma, an eminent personality of Indian politics, was born on 1st September 1947 in Chapahati, a tiny village of Garo Hills in Meghalaya. Sangma's early life was coloured in a simple and traditional setup which, given the cultural and geographical flavour of Northeastern India, must indeed have been rooted in a humble background. He started his schooling in Meghalaya and passed out his high school in Shillong. He earned his Bachelor of Arts from St. Anthony's College, Shillong. Continuing her interest in law and politics, she went on to do her Master of Arts in International Relations from Dibrugarh University, Assam. His education was thus the stepping stone of his public service.

Purno A Sangma started his political journey in the early seventies and became a member of the Meghalaya Legislative Assembly in 1973. He began his political career with very noble causes of social justice and the development of the country's Northeastern region. In 1977 he switched to national politics and was duly elected to the Lok Sabha, the Indian lower house of Parliament from Tura. This was the beginning of an extraordinary political career in the lower house that was to last for close to thirty-seven years.

In his political career, Sangma has been elected to several important posts in the government of India. He was the Minister of State for Commerce and Industry, Labour and Coal under Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi. The advocacy of labour organisations, industrialisation of the economy, and the welfare of the employees characterised the performance in these capacities. In 1991, he got the portfolio of Minister of Information and Broadcasting through which he was instrumental in opening up the Indian media industry.

In Could 2012, Purno A. Sangma was the founding president of the National People's Party (NPP) party having a regional focus in the northeastern part of the country. The NPP was launched to identify with the oppressed and less privileged people in the region's society. Zopko had finally founded the NPP and through his leadership as the first founder president of the party with emphasis on regionalism or decentralisation, social justice, or the common man's issues.

In his leadership, the NPP was soon established in Meghalaya and other states in the Northeast region as one of the major political parties. The strengths such as Sangma's closeness to the people and his knowledge of the South Asian issues helped the party. The performance improvement of the NPP was a testimony to Sangma's presence, agenda, and concern for the welfare of the people of the Northeast region of India.

He served in the parliament for more than three decades and passed away on March 4, 2016, due to cardiac arrest at the age of 68. He was succeeded with posthumously Padma Vibhushan, the second highest civilian award in India for his services in the political and social field.

introComponent.post: NATIONAL VICE-PRESIDENT & HON DEPUTY CHIEF MINISTER OF MEGHALAYA
introComponent.description: Prestone Tynsong is one of the prominent politicians from India who is discharging his duty as the 3rd Deputy Chief Minister for the Meghalaya region. From 2018 he has also served as the Minister for the Public Works Department Roads, Animal Husbandry, Veterinary & Animal Science, Housing, Labour & Parliamentary Affairs in Meghalaya. Tynsong has been associated with political parties including the National People's Party since 2017 and before joining the NPP was with INC. It has been noted that he has been an MLA OF Pynursla constituency in the Meghalaya Legislative Assembly since 2013.

aboutComponent.title: ABOUT PRESTONE TYNSONG
aboutComponent.description: Prestone Tynsong is a political figure from India who assumes the position of Deputy Chief Minister of Meghalaya now. His journey in politics has been marked by significant achievements and dedicated service to the state of Meghalaya.
additionalParagraphs: Prestone Tynsong is a political figure from India who assumes the position of Deputy Chief Minister of Meghalaya now. He assumed office in March 2023 and occupied the 4th position of the Deputy Chief Minister of the state affiliated with the National People's Party (NPP). He holds the position of Deputy Chief Minister with Snaiwbhalang Dhar in the Conrad Sangma-led government. Besides, Tynsong supervises more departments in the Meghalaya government such as District Council Affairs, Home, Parliamentary, and Public Works Departments identified for Roads and Building.

Tynsong entered a political contest by getting elected as a member of the Lyngkyrdem Assembly Constituency in the years 2003 and 2008 contesting for the INC party. He was elected to the Pynthor Suprupi Constituency in 2008 and later switched to the Pynursla Assembly Constituency in 2013. He was earlier a member of the INC however he switched to the NPP in the year 2017. He was then appointed as the Deputy Chief Minister of Meghalaya in the government headed by Conrad Sangma in the year 2018.

agriculture.description: The NPP is focused on strengthening the agricultural sector and improving logistics to enhance the livelihoods of the farmers and boost the economy.
agriculture.overviewText: Agriculture is a vital sector in any country as it is the primary food source for human beings. Research has indicated that approximately 36% of the population in the North East is currently living below the poverty line and most of them spend most of their time worrying about how to feed themselves adequately. Most large states in the region do not even meet the basic stock for important food commodities necessary for a healthy life hence the high incidences of malnutrition.

details.title: Agriculture and Logistics
details.text:
Regionally, and globally, sustainable agricultural practices are finding a new role in peopleâ€™s food security. In this regard, the National Peopleâ€™s Party should take appropriate measures towards promoting local strain agriculture that conserves the environment. The party also wants to introduce new concepts and scientific approaches to increase the yields in agriculture. Although there have been research developments in the agricultural field, additional work is required to ensure producers especially farmers in different fields like agricultural, horticultural, and other related fields get a market for their produce.
In most North Eastern states, the agricultural products are naturally organic and sold directly in local markets. There is a need to inspire farmers to innovate and add value to their products, which will help them earn better returns. Additionally, branding and promoting these farm products can tell their unique stories at regional, national, and global levels. The National Peopleâ€™s Party is committed to making agriculture a key driver of development, ensuring economic stability, and securing food for all. The main areas of focus will be agriculture and the environment, animal husbandry and fisheries, food technology and balancing output, and establishing market links to promote economic stability.

energy.description: The NPP is focused on promoting energy efficiency to reduce environmental impact, lower costs, and ensure sustainable development for future generations.
energy.overviewText: Energy conservation can be defined as the ability to perform a task with less energy as compared to its usual methods of accomplishing the tasks. There are numerous benefits of utilizing energy efficient technologies including a reduction in greenhouse emissions, decreased dependency on energy importation and ultimately saving of resources both for the consumer and the economy as a whole.

details.title: Energy Efficiency
details.text:
Renewable energy technologies also contribute towards these objectives, nevertheless, energy intensity reduction is usually the easiest and cheapest strategy to reduce the dependence on fossil energy sources. Pretty much every aspect of the economy, buildings, transportation, industry, and energy production to name but a few offer enormous potential for greater efficiency.
For instance, mobile upgrades such as replacing energy-leaching gadgets and appliances, increasing the insulation of structures, and replacing traditional bulbs with LED ones are possible solutions. In transportation, the strategy may mean increasing the fuel consumption rate or popularizing electric carsâ€™ use to minimize energy usage. For instance, in industries, using more efficient machinery and processes will make the energy consumption go down significantly while at the same time increasing production.
In the long run, therefore, reducing energy intensity not only contributes positively to the environment but also to the economy. This in turn presents the world with an opportunity to cut down on its use of energy from non-renewable sources hence attaining a better way of life. It's a win-win situation, so we conserve the earthâ€™s environment for future generations while at the same time cutting on expenses.

education.description: The NPP is dedicated to improving the quality of education by making it more accessible and equitable, with a focus on enhancing infrastructure and resources in rural and underserved areas.
education.overviewText: Regarding education, NPP has focused on marginalized groups and hence provides equal opportunities for Indigenous people and any other group of people. The party acknowledges the factor of integrated development by expanding its educational policies from compulsory and secondary education to collegiate, tertiary, and post tertiary learning including professional and trade training.

details.title: Inclusive Education Agenda
details.text:
Education for Indigenous people must also be enhanced to support the process of nation-building. Education is a tool that prepares the citizens to be productive in society and thus the growth of the country. Said the NPP that education will be useful in shaping the fate, welfare, prosperity success, and security of these democratic communities in the future.
Education in general is one of the major problems to be addressed by NPP, as it is a way to provide people with the necessary tools to build their lives. Education will empower people to change their lives and at large enhance the growth of society as a whole. It also continues to aim and work for the future where no community is left behind in the overall development.

environment.description: The NPP is committed to protecting the environment through sustainable practices and policies that address the challenges of climate change, deforestation, and pollution.
environment.overviewText: Global warming is a global threat that poses significant risks to our social, economic, and security systems. As such, we are willing to combat climate change since the consequences are not only felt by us but also by future generations of human beings. We aim to improve the generation of clean energy besides offering other forms of income, especially for people who depend on agriculturally unsustainable practices like human cultivation that pose a threat to the environment. More specifically, our efforts will be to reverse the impacts of climate change, conserve natural resources, and keep our environment, air, water, and soil clean for generations to come.

details.title: NPP's Environmental Commitment
details.text:
For instance, the National Peopleâ€™s Party (NPP) is in the process of addressing some of the major environmental problems through the promotion of renewable energy and preserving the environment. We believe that protecting the environment is crucial for building a sustainable future for India. As a signatory to the Paris Agreement, India has a responsibility to lead by example and take action to combat climate change.
We must take proper care of our planet so that there will be a better future for the next generations. We require propelling discourse among our people so they are also in a position to be informed of how they can make a difference by minimizing their use of carbon. It doesnâ€™t matter how big or small the change is, it all counts in the battle against climate change through choices such as using renewable energy, saving water, and minimizing the amount of wastage. Together for change, there are possibilities of making the environment better for all people and making the changes sustainable.

healthcare.description: The NPP is focused on improving the healthcare system by making it more accessible, affordable, and efficient, especially in rural and underserved areas.
healthcare.overviewText: Modern Indiaâ€™s health care system is not very favorable, especially for the Indian BPL and lower castes or tribespeople. Due to the lack of proper health care or health facilities in rural and remote hilly areas, many people die of lifestyle diseases that can be treated if proper medical care is available when needed. For this reason, as a party, we are very sensitive to this problem and realize the level of infection that affects all of us. The foundation will essentially be in this area as we seek to implement the necessary changes to meet the needs of people especially those with limited or no access to quality medical attention, an expensive affair in most cases.

details.title: Ensuring Health for All
details.text:
Private health care in India is very expensive as it is inaccessible most of the time to the common citizens of this country. That is why we want to enhance the capacities of government healthcare institutions to prepare them for future healthcare issues. This means that it is possible to ensure that public health gets a facelift hence enabling everybody especially the needy to attain their medical needs at an affordable cost.
The promise is to accord health care a strategic sector by delivering medical security and improving the welfare of the average citizen through the provision of enhanced healthcare facilities since health is a fundamental need, and the care system requires vigorous reforms to improve the lot of the patients, doctors and the nation as a whole. Enhancing the healthcare outcome will have the net effect of enhancing the health of the nation hence a healthier nation is a prosperous nation.

promoting_northeast.description: The NPP is committed to promoting the unique culture, economy, and development of the North Eastern region, ensuring that it receives the attention and resources it deserves.
promoting_northeast.overviewText: North East India is a Multicultural and Multilingual region as all the states have their history and culture. This region is known for the dominating indigenous populations along with their religions and beliefs. North East India is one of the most beautiful regions of the country that is full of diverse wildlife, bird species, flora, and fauna, the region is populated with more than 166 tribes having different languages. Since it is a frontier region it has a long international border of more than 2000 km with neighboring countries such as Bhutan, China, Myanmar, and Bangladesh. However, the region has not been in the news for the positive things like growth, developments, and or changes but rather the bad things such as insurgency, migration, corruption, and ethnic clashes.

details.title: Promoting North East
details.text:
Despite the cultural and many similarities with the South East Asian neighbors the region of the North East has not fully unlocked all its potential for development. even today the region remains somewhat backward with the rest of the country and there is a long distance to travel still. Inequality is a very serious problem, and sensitive areas such as education, health care, tourism, agriculture, animal breeding, power, oil, and other related industries require serious attention.
The northeast is characterized by very poor socio-economic scores showing that the area has not developed and is degrading. The North East region has remained highly inconsequential economically even after 75 years of independence of India and it has never been able to realize the potential growth it deserves. Efforts and investment are required to address the challenges and place concentration on the regions so that they can achieve the desired potential as any other area of India. By so doing, one will be able to solve these problems and lay the foundation for the North Eastâ€™s development towards becoming a prosperous region that will be able to make more positive contributions to the growth of the nation.

women.description: The NPP is focused on empowering women through initiatives that ensure their safety, education, and economic independence, addressing the challenges they face in society.
women.overviewText: Gender equity has always been one of the primary goals of our party ideology. As for the policy on employment, we remain strong advocates of the â€˜â€™all work equal payâ€™â€™ as the best way of empowering people through employment. NPP strives for gender justice, including womenâ€™s rights and gender non-binary; NPP. Issues of gender equality and womenâ€™s human rights are our concerns, especially the need to access health care services, education, decent employment, political leadership, and other decision-making capacities.

details.title: Women-Centric Initiatives
details.text:
NPP fully encourages people to get legal assistance within the shortest time possible and NPP offers psychosocial support for anyone affected by sexual and gender-based violence. That is why women and gender minorities require humanityâ€™s focus to ensure influence in shaping a more democratic and just society. Empowering individuals through employment and enhancing their skills, particularly by utilizing their traditional knowledge, is a key part of our vision.
As a party, we know that women are noble assets in the formation of the future of the country. That is why we will aim to portray gender justice in as many aspects as possible allowing women and gender minorities equal opportunities and a say in all areas of life. In embracing these values it becomes possible to create a society that can support each person and contribute to the growth of the nation.

youth.description: The NPP is dedicated to empowering the youth by providing them with opportunities in education, employment, and entrepreneurship, recognizing them as the key drivers of the nation's future.
youth.overviewText: Many educated youths in the North Eastern States of India are experiencing insecurity owing to the absence of employment in the region. Still, due to several reasons, they lose their job and are compelled to go to other regions of the country in search of better working opportunities. The miseries of unemployment are on the increase and hence deserve the attention they need. As young people grow up and find themselves in challenging circumstances they usually feel abandoned and lonely.

details.title: Youth Focus
details.text:
Currently, there are only one or two private organizations or any kind of business houses that could offer employment in the entire North East and the limited scope of employment in the government sectors has only made the situation worse. This calls for a serious investment in sectors like tourism and hotels, agriculture, and the rest that can take our youths and give them the means to earn a living. This has made many youths feel useless given the fact that they do not have an opportunity to make something out of themselves.
NPP has also acknowledged this issue as important noting that it is indeed a key concern to empower the youth. It calls for the establishment of more business and income-generating opportunities by associating the youths with the wonderful natural resources of the region. Even though universities and other institutions have established the trend of awarding degrees to many of the intending students, many of those who graduate especially in the area of agriculture, horticulture, and veterinary sciences are still after government employment opportunities. In this case, they fail to recognize the opportunity of private companies in their areas of interest.
NPP aims at mobilizing educated youths and professionals to harness the many opportunities that are available in the region. The party feels that youth need to be transformed in a way to embrace other kinds of opportunities apart from government employment the ability to be employers and employees and to be able to come up with business ventures among other productive activities that make them employable.
